data.author: Taehun Lim
data.message:
Added humble branch (#1)

foros: migration to humble hawksbill

- asnyc_send_request() returns a std::future instead of a std::shared_future
- get_callback_group() is replaced with for_each_callback_group()
- publish() is not a virtual function anymore

Signed-off-by: Taehun Lim <thlim@robotis.com>

data.author: Wonguk Jeong
data.message:
foros: inspector implemented

enable inspector with environment variables
- FOROS_INSPECTOR : 1 to enable
- FOROS_INSPECTOR_PERIOD : inspector message publish period

if inspector is enabled, publish inspector message every
FOROS_INSPECTOR_PERIOD second(s)

data.author: Wonguk Jeong
data.message:
foros: maintain persistent data using leveldb

election_term, voted_for, voted values should be
stored in storage. (deleted on reboot)

Therefore,
1) created raft context store using leveldb
2) add options to set temp directory. default is
    std::filesystem::temp_directory_path()

TODO: add command logs in store

Signed-off-by: Wonguk Jeong <wonguk.jeong@42dot.ai>

data.author: Wonguk Jeong

data.author: Wonguk Jeong
data.message:
fsros: implement basic APIs for ros2 node

In order to provide same semantic, syntax of APIs,
implemented most of APIs of rclcpp::Node
Except:
- sub node, sub name space are excluded
- generic publisher, gerneric subscriptions is excluded

Signed-off-by: Wonguk Jeong <wonguk.jeong@42dot.ai>

data.author: Wonguk Jeong
data.message:
fsros: do not use cluster name as namespace

Namespace is normally used for isolating machine
 in the link local network.
 Therefore, do not use  cluster name as namespace,
 but mangle node name using the cluster name.

as-is:
- namespace: cluster_name
- node name: "node" + node_id

to-be:
- node name: cluster_name + node_id

Signed-off-by: Wonguk Jeong <wonguk.jeong@42dot.ai>

data.author: Wonguk Jeong
data.message:
fsros_example: rename service name

"Cluster name" is namespace of the node.
therefore, if we omit '/' in front of the service name,
namespace is attached automatically in front of service name.

Use service name started by "/" for service/client example

Signed-off-by: Wonguk Jeong <wonguk.jeong@42dot.ai>

data.author: Wonguk Jeong
data.message:
fsros: implement leader

data.author: Wonguk Jeong
data.message:
fsros: candidate's entry, timeout implemented

start election on timedout or entry of Candidat state

start election behavior:
1) increase term
2) vote for me
3) reset election timer

Signed-off-by: Wonguk Jeong <wonguk.jeong@42dot.ai>

data.author: Wonguk Jeong
data.message:
fsros: change cluster node constructor

Due to naming ambiguity, use integer not string for IDs

- as-is
node name (string), cluster name (string),
cluster node names (vector of string)

- to-be
node id (uint32_t), cluster name(string),
cluster node names (vector of uint32_t)

Signed-off-by: Wonguk Jeong <wonguk.jeong@42dot.ai>

data.author: Wonguk Jeong
data.message:
fsros: handle AppendEntries RPC in super class

Since the RPC handling logic is same, move it to super class named "State"

Signed-off-by: Wonguk Jeong <wonguk.jeong@42dot.ai>

data.author: Wonguk Jeong
data.message:
fsros: use single election timer in the fsm

as-is: create timer instance in the each state
to-be: manage single timer in the context
Signed-off-by: Wonguk Jeong <wonguk.jeong@42dot.ai>

data.author: Wonguk Jeong
data.message:
fsros: implement follower's timeotu behavior

- On append_entries message received, reset timer
- On election timer expired, emit Timedout event
  (transition to Candidate state by state machine)

Signed-off-by: Wonguk Jeong <wonguk.jeong@42dot.ai>

data.author: Wonguk Jeong
data.message:
fsros: create election timer in follower state

1) Major changes
When entered into Follower state (entry()),
start election timeout timer of randomized period
between min, max (default: 150ms, 300ms)

2) Minor refactoring
Define common::Context class to maintain
ros handles and provide utilities such as timer

Signed-off-by: Wonguk Jeong <wonguk.jeong@42dot.ai>

data.author: Wonguk Jeong
data.message:
fsros: create raft RPC clients

"append entries", "request voite" clients
are created  in the raft state machine

Client name is mangled by using the names of nodes in the cluster.
- /{cluster name}/{node name}/append_entries
 - /{cluster name}/{node name}/request_vote
